## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons  share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances  pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

Example: <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/100000>

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

</details>

</details>

### Terms

comment.body:
Adam, I spent some time messing around with the safari debugger on my Mac connected to my iPad. Again, I know very little about web stuff but Im retired from a life in IT so I get around and clearly must be a little bored. Anyway, when I go to a story like this one: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/01/19/us/desantis-florida-ap-african-american-studies.html I think it runs a script that is contained in another file https://www.nytimes.com/vi-assets/static-assets/story-7b870824025a8e3b4049.js That script appears to have code in it that adds a class dynamically to the original HTML page using createelement statement. That class does this pop-up thing I believe. I browsed the page directly on the Mac (no iPad) and while it does run the same script which contains the same code, it does not add it to the page on the Mac. Im guessing there is logic in the script somewhere that determines the platform. The class that gets added to the page is below (though I manually formated it). I am wondering if blocking it with a Safari user rule on the iPad would work. But Im not sure exactly how content filters are formatted. Would you be willing to help me with the safari user rule syntax? Im guessing its something like nytimes.com ###div.read-in-app. But I tried a few variations and had no luck. Would the user rule prevent the script from adding the div class programmatically? Anyway I appreciate all your help. Here is the class that gets created:

Continue reading in the app its better

Stay logged in and get customized notifications.

Exploring articles will be easier, too.

> On Jan 19, 2023, at 1:31 AM, Adam ***@***.***> wrote: > > > @AdamWr could you please take a look? > > Unfortunately, I have no idea how to reproduce this, I don't even see it even when I'm logged in. > Could you please try to block this grey element by using the Block elements on this page option? > To use this option, please tap on the AdGuard icon on Safari's address bar and then try to select this grey element, maybe created rule will be helpful. > If this rule will works, then please provide it here. > > > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub , or unsubscribe . > You are receiving this because you were mentioned. >

commits.message:
merge duplicate rules 5 (#140539)

* ##.push-popup

comment.body:
Thank you for great investigation.

>Here is the class that gets created:
>```
><div class="read-in-app-disrupter shown expanded expanded-dock css-1y8ywa3 efw9frv0" data-testid="expanded-dock" >aria-label="A message from The Times">
>    <div class="css-1fub061 e2qmvq0">
>[...]
>```

Perhaps something like this:
```adblock
nytimes.com##.read-in-app-disrupter
```
will be enough.
Could you please add it (`nytimes.com##.read-in-app-disrupter`) to the user rules and check if issue still occurs?

>Would the user rule prevent the script from adding the div class programmatically?

This user rule should hide element with the class `read-in-app-disrupter`, so it should not be visible, although I'm not sure if this grey overlay will be also hidden by this rule.

comment.body:
Hi,
I guess that print/email buttons might be intentionally blocked by these filter lists, but I'm not sure about the PDF button.
Anyway, I think that next time it would be better to report it to the appropriate repository.
For Fanboys Annoyances filters here - https://github.com/easylist/easylist/issues
For Web Annoyances Ultralist here - https://github.com/yourduskquibbles/webannoyances/issues

<hr>

@ryanbr, @yourduskquibbles could you please take a look?

comment.body:
> Hello, @githhairreid Could you please add this rule:
> 
> ```
> techcyan.com$$script[wildcard="*constructor*DOMContentLoaded*0x"][min-length="2000"][max-length="5000"]
> ```
> 
> to user rules, then wait couple of seconds (until rule will be applied), refresh website and then check if issue still occurs?

wow you guys are great it works.

amazing . thank you so much for your time sir.

comment.body:
Please try this:

1. Disable **secure DNS** in Chrome settings

```bash
chrome://settings/security
```

2. Disable **Async DNS resolver**

```bash
chrome://flags/#enable-async-dns
```

3. Press both buttons here

```bash
chrome://net-internals/#sockets
```

4. Press  **Clear host cache** here

```bash
chrome://net-internals/#dns
```

comment.body:
The task is closed due to a suspicion of spam.

The task is part of a large group of similar issues:
1. It is not critical (the site/application is rarely visited)
2. This whole group of issues is probably created by one person

Unfortunately, we can't afford to handle every such issue. In this case, we may not have enough time to deal with higher priority tasks from AdGuard users.

Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: mail.ru

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If youre using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If youre using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)
